timeline.author: vesense

replies.bodyText:
After reading codes, I find sqlArgumentsList is for MetricService, which is for logging the query history (and its execution plan..). So, the field is write-intense and read-rare.
Is CopyOnWriteArrayList has better performance than synchronized  in this way?
Besides, @qiaojialin, don't you need to add lock for reading the list? (line 46 in QueryServlet.java)
replies.author: jixuan1989

replies.bodyText: Hi, the sqlArgumentList is a write-intensive with nearly no read. The copy in read is used.
replies.author: qiaojialin
